name: Methods that do not use instance fields\methods should be static (.NET)
description:
All methods that don't use instance fields will be reported except if they have been extended in a subclass or inherit from their parents.

For all .Net Classes, including .Net Forms : 
If a method doesn't use an instance field or const, it should be declared static except if the method is overriden or override another method.
output: All methods that don't use instance fields (either const or not) will be reported except if they have been extended in a subclass or inherit from their parents.
rationale:
When an object is created:
    * Memory is allocated to all the fields
    * All super class fields are also allocated memory
    * All sub class fields, super class fields are initialized .
    * The constructor is invoked.
Make use of static and avoid to create an object that takes resources which is unnecessary.
remediation: Make the method static if not using instance members.
alternativeName: Methods that do not use instance fields\methods should be static (.NET)

technicalCriteria.name: Efficiency - Memory, Network and Disk Space Management
